{docbook}
<abstract>
 <para>This chapter supplies you with the basic knowledge of the following topics:</para>
    <itemizedlist>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="SOCref.DevelopersReferences.UIExtensions">UI Extensions</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
          <para>Knowledge about Activity Plugin which is used to allow using the activity composer extension and the custom UI component for displaying activity by its type.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="SOCref.DevelopersReferences.OverridableComponents">Overridable Components</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
        <para>Description on two overridable components in Social: Space Application Handler and Space Service.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="SOCref.DevelopersReferences.PublicJavaAPIs">Public Java APIs</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
        <para>Information on public Java APIs used in Social.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="SOCref.DevelopersReferences.SampleCode_Tutorial">Java APIs sample code/ tutorial</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
        <para>Provision of sample code/tutorial about using Java APIs in Social.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="SOCref.DevelopersReferences.PublicREST_APIs">Public REST APIs</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
        <para>Information (such as name, service URL, service URL endpoint, location, parameter, and description) on Public REST APIs used in Social.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="SOCref.DevelopersReferences.RestService_APIs">Rest Service APIs</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
        <para>Provision of knowledge about using Rest Service APIs which allows the third parties to write any applications (desktop apps, mobile apps, web apps) to integrate with Social services and business.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="SOCref.DevelopersReferences.PublicJavascriptAPIs">Public Javascript APIs</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
        <para>Provision of a link containing all references for Opensocial Javascript APIs.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="SOCref.Social_JCR_Structure">Social JCR Structure</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
        <para>Provision of comprehensive knowledge about Social JCR Structure that is organized to conform to the data storage for the individual purpose of Social.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="SOCref.Space_Template_Configuration">Spaces Template configuration</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
        <para>Provision of simple and explicit examples about spaces template configuration in Social.</para>
      </listitem>
      <listitem>
        <para>
          <emphasis role="bold">
            <link linkend="SOCref.ConfigureOauth2_Legend_Scenario">Configure the oauth 2 legged scenario</link>
          </emphasis> </para>
        <para>Provision of configuring the oAuth 2 legs scenario in OpenSocial.  </para>
      </listitem>
    </itemizedlist>
    <para>With this knowledge, you can extend more functions for Social, or customize them as you want.</para>
	</abstract>
{docbook}
